TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AssemblyFileVersionAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Instructs a compiler to use a specific version number for the Win32 file version resource. The Win32 file version is not required to be the same as the assembly's version number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the AssemblyFileVersionAttribute is not supplied, the <xref:System.Reflection.AssemblyVersionAttribute> is used for the Win32 file versionthat is displayed on the **Version** tab of the Windows file properties dialog.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string version) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the file version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The file version is normally a string of four numbers, separated by periods, reflecting the major version number, minor version number, build number, and revision number; for example, "1.0.4309.00". If `version` is not in this format, a compiler warning occurs, and the results displayed in the file properties dialog are unpredictable. Wildcards are not supported.

Docs.summary: Gets the Win32 file version resource name.
Docs.value: A string containing the file version resource name.
